comment: There's a quiz before almost every lab that is usually based on the vocab on the pre-labs. Hendrix is very nice but he rambles a lot about things not needed for prelab, but when he does talk about the pre-lab, he's very thorough. He is also very clear about what is need to pass the practicum.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I really enjoyed Hendrix for microbio Lab. I had a hard time at first adjusting to the quiz each week, but once I took the time to study for them i did well. I ended up pulling out an A which I was surprised about. The final wont be as hard as you think. Take him! Hes actually pretty funny.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: It definitely is a very tough class, but Dr. Hendrix is very empathetic towards students who demonstrate effort. His lectures are a bit challenging to follow through considering that he reads the board and barely faces the class. Overall, I can attest that I definitely learned and understood a lot of material by the end of the semester.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Hilarious--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Hendrix is tough! His test are straightforward and so are his pop quizzes but if you're not the type of student to review notes and MEMORIZE everything- I suggest you try another professor because you will fail and he will not help you. You need to out in work to pass this class but it is possible!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Spends time in class telling you that you'll most likely fail. Gets off topic a lot. Don't take him if you struggle with science courses. Kind of old school, reads straight from the power point, packs up his stuff and leaves. Doesn't really care if you're failing, he kind of expects the majority of the class to.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Avoid taking his class if you can. This was the first C I've ever received. He gives pop TESTS, which can break your grade because you never know when one is coming. He goes on a lot of tangents, so most of the class period is him talking about irrelevant stuff. Both the pop tests and regular exams are difficult because of the wording he uses.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Not the worst teacher I've ever had but he is not the best. He takes the entire time to go over everything then starts yelling at the class for absolutely nothing. I don't recommend taking him for microbio lab. He isn't understanding and taking Grier would be 10 times better. Live and ya learn.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Hendrix has a lot of knowledge about microbiology, but he is very arrogant and rants about things that don't even relate to the topic. I had him for lab and he lectured us for an hour and fifteen minutes about how to use a microscope (mind you we have all been using microscopes for our last four labs).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: You have a pre and post lab quiz every lab. As long as you read the lab outline and study it you should be fine. The only downside to this professor is that he talks ALOT. Going through the syllabus on the first day took about an hour and a half (also, no chairs so you're standing the whole time). Otherwise, its an easy A.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria

comment: He is sometimes hilarious. A lot of times wonky. And, even more often than not loud and obnoxious. BUT, he's a great professor all in all. I don't regret taking him. He's tough, but it's possible to get the grade you want.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Agree with last review. All he talks about is how he used to be department chair, how much he knows, how smart he is, how much better he is than every other KSU professor, etc and that isn't the info that will be on the test. I will never take him again.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: A.V.O.I.D. I hear he is great for genetics, but he was AWFUL for the rest. I would rather drop out than take another class with him. Condescending and rude! You arent allowed to ask questions during class or why you get points off on a test or pop test! HORRIBLE!!! I had a 3.9 until I took this prude.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: 2 exams, 4 Pop Tests and the Final are the only grades. Coming to class is the best way to get an A and he makes class interesting. Honestly the funniest professor I've ever had. His class is tough but it is worth it. Office hours are helpful and he sometimes tells you when the Pop Tests will be!! Just study really hard and prepare for class
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Hendrix is great and tells you exactly what it takes to get an A. He even helps you understand what terms will be on the test and what to study specifically. This is amazing help considering each powerpoint slide for any science class is incredibly long. Their are only 3 tests but if you do good on the final he will replace your lowest the final
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Tests are very straight forward. If you memorize his powerpoints and read the textbook you should make an A.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY--Would take again

comment: Gives good study tips
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I dont dislike this professor, but he definitely needs some work. He often wastes time telling meaningless stories and getting angry out of sheer nowhere. Powerpoints are very long but hell sometimes give you a list of terms that will be on the exam. Comes in late all the time and wastes time. However, exams were pretty easy and based off notes.
rating_tags: Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Attend Lecture to get an A. This is one of those classes that can boost your moral and he has a lot of knowledge to pass on if you listen. You will get bored and if you do fall asleep hope you record his lecture so you won't miss any important detail. Everything you need for this class is posted on d2l. easy A if you pay attention in class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: There are in class quizzes every lab, so attendance is mandatory. He talks A LOT at the beginning of lab, but makes sure to make the lab as easy as possible for you. Make sure you study the bolded words & numbers in the lab book. He was a good lab teacher. Take him
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: I took his genetics lab course. He talks ALOT! But he made the assessments really easy. We also got to leave early a few times, and sometimes he made lab optional for the day. Easy A! I had Chen the first time and she was much harder than he was.
Took classes with him in 1991.  Went on to finish medical school and have a thriving practice.  Much was due to Dr. Hendrix  inspiring me to learn in his classes.
rating_tags: Respected--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Hendrix is a very smart guy, don't get me wrong. He's very good at explaining things in detail. But, he tends to spend a lot of time talking about himself, and then doesn't like to answer questions that the class has. He expects you to memorize his PowerPoints word-for-word. Tests are tricky. Pop tests. You may want to go with another professor.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He gets angry sometimes, but is a good guy. Study for his test and his pop quizzes will help. BUT NUMBER ONE TIP DO NOT ASK QUESTIONS DURING LECTURE!!!!!!! Also he tends to pull questions similar to his study guide questions.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Dr. Hendrix gives pop tests which aren't as bad as they sound but do require you to keep up with the readings/powerpoints 100%. He's helpful outside of class. I have taken him twice now and he's one of my favorite profs in the biology department, despite being one of the tougher choices. Your only grades are 8 pop tests, a midterm, and a final.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: Micro lab was easy and straightforward with Dr. Hendrix.  Wish I could have had him for lecture.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria

comment: He's a good choice. Cracks some funny one liners every now and then. He will make your life 10X easier during pre lab lecture if your class respects him and follows his directions that simplify the detailed worksheet instructions. If not, he'll get mad and you can expect a written prelab quiz. Thoroughly read worksheets to do well on the quizzes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Dr. Hendrix gives pop tests, which are not as scary as they sound. (I almost dropped when I heard that.) They're thorough but easy to master once you know how he tests. His class is good for those that like unstructured classes; he doesn't give homework and lets you decide how to learn. I would definitely take him again.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Hendrix is by far my favorite teacher at KSU! I took him for Micro and Adv Micro; Loved each with him! Tests are tough but it's a tough class. Study your notes, make flash cards and review before class starts in case of a pop quiz! Labs were fun and he is always willing to help! I miss his funny stories, he was hilarious! Def would take again!
Just show up to the class and study the powerpoints, you will make a easy B. An easy A needs just a little more though.

Hendrix did not teach this class, we had TAs. There are pre-quizes every class and post-quizes on each unit. The final is much easier than an anatomy practical but you have to study and read for this class every week. If you take the time for it you will get an A. lowest 4 quiz grades are dropped!

Dr. Hendrix is okay but not the best. He's actually really good in lab but spends so much time talking about how great he is (used to be department chair blah blah blah). Class seems pointless but he will talk about random things and then put them on the test. Tests are extremely detailed.  Make sure you memorize his slides. Expect 2 quizzes a week

Nice guy, funny, but very monotone. Hard to sit through lecture as he goes off on a lot of tangents about life. He also talks during quizzes/tests which is extremely frustrating. Don't ever expect him to respond to an email either!

If you enjoy being berated for things you haven't done yet, told that you're probably not fit to be in college, and given his personal reviews of what movies he likes, take Hendrix.  If you like tests over material that you've reviewed, but in ways you haven't learned to apply the knowledge, take Hendrix. Other than that, steer clear.

Had him for cell & molecular and ended up with a B which I had to WORK HARD for. Do not slack off, thinking it's an easy A cos it's not. It's a 4000 level class, more information, more stuff you have to know. 2 exams, 1 final. The final replaces your lowest of 2 exams. STUDY the notes AND book. Do NOT wait the last minute.

Dr. Hendrix is wonderful professor one of the best I have had. Most the people who take him study only his old exams not posted on his website. That is how everyone flies by in his class. The people who do not do well do not have his past exams which are not posted online. So if you find someone with the past exams you'll get your A!!!

I had genetics and micro with Hendrix, easy A's if you are genius like me!! Show up to class review the lectures everyday no reason to make a B! If you make a C you really aren't science material, switch majors!
So boring, his lectures continue to drag on. Goes on tangents all the time and gets pissed off for no reason.

Dr. Hendrix is not a bad professor but several people cheated their way through cell bio by stealing the exams and having some sort of code during the exam and 80% of the class made a 100 on exam 2 and finished the exam in less than 20 minutes; seriously... I guess he got upset and decided to punish the whole class with the final which was brutal.

He was fair in the beginning, but since he caught some students cheating, he decided to take his anger out on the whole class. Although the final replaces the lowest test grade, a lot of the material on the final is not from lecture, notes, lab, or book.

Hendrix is not that bad, but his first test should not be underestimated and the final was torture! He had got really upset becuase people were cheating and he was getting back at them with his final I guess

Dr. Hendrix is a good professor. That said, he's incredibly random and will have 99% of people falling asleep during lecture. His tests are fair and he tries to make sure you know everything. Study and you'll be fine. He tries to kill genetics students, so if you have to take that get someone else unless you like a challenge.

He doesn't reply emails. He has said students can complain but b/c he's tenured, they won't fire him so he doesn't care. He shows up for class late (repeatedly)-- today, 25 mins late. He's locked a student out for going to the bathroom. He repeats stupid stories basically he's a disheveled mess who gets randomly ticked off. Basically

He gets off topic a lot but he's a good professor. he'd use cartoon examples to help us understand genetics. he was very caring towards his students. if you think you can wing everything, don't take this class. you have to put effort in it but it's worth it. take him, he's amazing!
His lectures are extremely boring, you may find yourself falling asleep. He shows up 10-15 mins late. No one shows up to class. He doesnt hand anything back on time. Tests are horribly.

He was AWESOME(test wise). His notes come from his power points. Soo study them and you'll do just fine.  The class is basically memorization. Hes a bit boring and attendance is not required. He post old exams which are like his new ones. Can't go wrong!
Dr. Hendrix is awesome!  He is a wonderful teacher, he loves what he does, and he always has funny stories to tell during lectures.  I will take him again if I have the chance!

Took this course Summer '07 and Dr Hendrix was terrific...very approachable and helpful. Powerpoints posted on WebCT so you can download and supplement during lecture. Very helpful in lab. Not an easy course...but it's Microbiology!! Would definitely recommend

I heard he ws easygoing but not His lectures are so boging in microbiol most of the class was not paying attention more than half of the time. too much material to study for tests most of the test questions are not even covered during test like graphs and stuff but READ THE BOOK

Very Good teacher but does not have a clue that  his students are  cheating.. His test are mere memorizing but I had to  study really hard just to get by. He goes the extra mile to help you out and he cares  about his students but I think he should change his testing policy  so the kids who don't cheat have a fair advantage  too.  recommend taking!

This man is the best microbiology professor ever. He takes interest in your ideas and encourages thought. You can learn enough to gain employment in his lab. Get him rolling on quotes from Fox in Socks by Dr. Seuss - he recites from memory. You certainly will not be disapponted in this fellow and his class

Dr. Hendrix is a wonderful professor.  Wish we had a lot more like him in the biology department!  Well knowledgeable and very helpful!  He provides all the information needed through his pwpt presentations. If you show up for classes and study his notes, you're guaranteed an A!
Don't let that Southern drawl fool you - What he doesn't already know, he'll go the extra mile to find out for you! I miss you!

All the material comes from the notes, book is only for extra understanding of the material.  his tests are tricky, like a,b, and not c  and a,b,and c.  stuff like that to make you second guess yourself. common, give me a break
